item.title: Road flooded, the developer has infilled the drainage ditch, 4th January
item.description:
The developer has infilled the drainage ditch, which was the boundary of the former field, they have infilled it for a new driveway. the road now floods with inches of water after rainfall, which cannot drain into hatherley brook, this is causing issues for cars, pedestrian & cyclists; when it freezes, it becomes very dangerous. A storm drain needs to be put in & fed into the former drain ditch
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pheasant Lane, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working on a large area including Notgrove Close, 4th January
item.description:

item.title: Pottersfield Road sign was apparently vandalised on 23/12/23., 4th January
item.description:
Outside No. 1 Pottersfield Road at junction of New Road. The sign was found down Station Road that evening. Not sure if anyone else has reported this, no record of it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pottersfield Road, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 4th January
item.description:
FMS rcvd 30.12.23 - Every time there is wind the tree sheds branches which fall onto our driveway. This poses a risk to our children, people waiting at the bus stop and also to our cars. We would ask that the tree is fully checked and dead branches removed. I would appreciate a response on this issue as it has been an ongoing concern for safety.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A board belonging to BOOKS & INK obstructing the pavement, 4th January
item.description:
In the MIDDLE of the pavement outside Books & Ink. 6 North St, Winchcombe. I went in ti ask the female owner if she could please relocate the board. She was very challenging, saying that someone had moved it. Si I said I could wait while she repositioned it to a place which would allow the safe passage of mums with pushchairs, disabled folks in mobility scooters and wheelchair users. She didn't move saying again that someone had moved it. I told her I myself had just had to walk in the road around it. She just sneered saying it was better than parked cars. I didn't actually see the relevance of that. She really embarrassed herself but after quite a while she did go and move it slightly. Passive aggressive...."you have a lovely new year too". I feel that she will put it again on the pavement causing an obstruction....merely because she is that way out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13a, North Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 4th January
item.description:
I manage Crickley Hill nature reserve and we are planning some tree felling work to improve the habitat for adders (among others). There is an old pedestrian gate on the south side of Cold Slad Lane (near Clair-de-Lune House, GL3 4UQ) marked by a question mark on the screenshot below. The gate hasnâ€™t been used for a long time, and doesnâ€™t go anywhere, just into impassable scrub and trees. It isnâ€™t marked on the online GCC PRoW map (where the screenshot is from), but Iâ€™m aware the online map isnâ€™t definitive. I was wondering if you could confirm whether or not there is a public right of way at this location?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
